TITLE: Dishonesty around money could be a relationship killer, couples say. Here's what successful partners do differently
SUMMARY: Secrecy or dishonesty around money could be a relationship killer, a new survey finds. Plus, couples who manage money best are talking about it at least weekly.

TITLE: These are the best ways to give to charity for the 'vast majority of people.' Here's how to pick the most tax-efficient strategy
SUMMARY: If you're planning a charitable gift for 2022, here's how to decide on the most tax-efficient strategy.

TITLE: Arizona attorney general calls student loan forgiveness 'unconstitutional' in legal challenge to Biden's plan
SUMMARY: Arizona Attorney General Mark Brnovich has brought a legal challenge against the Biden administration's sweeping student loan forgiveness plan.

TITLE: Unrelenting inflation is taking a toll, leaving more Americans living paycheck to paycheck
SUMMARY: With persistent inflation weighing on consumers, even high earners are feeling financially strained.

TITLE: In a reversal, the Education Department is now excluding some borrowers from student loan relief
SUMMARY: Federal student loan borrowers whose loans are not held by the U.S. Department of Education won't be able to consolidate for forgiveness, a new update shows.

TITLE: Hurricane Ian is a reminder for all homeowners to check their insurance for coverage of natural disasters
SUMMARY: Whether your house is in an area prone to hurricanes, tornadoes, flooding, hail or wildfires, it's important to know what your insurance covers or excludes.

SUMMARY: If you're wrestling with tax debt, you may have options like an installment agreement or a penalty abatement through the IRS. Here's what filers need to know.

SUMMARY: Early sales events can be a great opportunity to save money on holiday gifts at a time when consumers feel cash-strapped.

TITLE: As Biden vows to 'protect' Social Security, here's what we know about the future of benefits
SUMMARY: While President Joe Biden took issue at a Tuesday event with several GOP plans for Social Security, he did not propose specific plans to save the program.

TITLE: Higher-income Medicare beneficiaries may see smaller premium surcharges in 2023. Here are tips for reducing them even more
SUMMARY: Although the so-called income-related adjustment amounts, or IRMAAs, will be smaller in 2023, there may still be strategies for reducing what you pay.

TITLE: IRS erred on child tax credit payments for millions of eligible families — but aid was 98% accurate overall, report finds
SUMMARY: The IRS skipped advanced child tax credit payments for millions and mistakenly sent payments to filers who didn't qualify. But aid was 98% accurate overall.

TITLE: Papa John's is the latest employer to offer free college for frontline workers
SUMMARY: Free college as a workplace benefit is increasingly popular. Papa John's expanded this offering to 12,000 full- and part-time staff.

TITLE: What the first legal challenge to derail Biden's student loan forgiveness plan means for borrowers
SUMMARY: A conservative legal group brought the first legal challenge to President Joe Biden's sweeping plan to cancel up to $20,000 in student debt for millions of people.

SUMMARY: High inflation and stock market turbulence may be giving new retirees financial jitters. These strategies can help them settle into this new life stage.

TITLE: Even as expanded child tax credit helped millions out of poverty, some still haven’t accessed funds
SUMMARY: While millions of individuals and families benefitted from expanded tax credits last year, some have yet to file for the money.

TITLE: 8 million student loan borrowers will get automatic forgiveness. Here's what you need to know
SUMMARY: Borrowers enrolled in income-driven student loan repayment plans will get their debt automatically discharged. Yet experts recommend they still take some steps.

TITLE: Medicare standard Part B premiums will drop by 3% next year, to $164.90
SUMMARY: Lower-than-expected spending on Part B is allowing the Medicare program to reduce next year's premiums for beneficiaries.

SUMMARY: With ongoing market volatility and high inflation, many wonder if we’re headed for a prolonged downturn. Here's what to expect for the end of 2022, experts say.

TITLE: Millennials, bailing on stocks and other investments, might not find bonds so boring anymore

SUMMARY: If you're thinking about canceling your contract, be sure you know what the financial repercussions would be.

SUMMARY: Around 6 million older Americans are living below the poverty line. Fortunately, there are thousands of resources available to struggling seniors.

SUMMARY: Food and coffee chains debuted the "PSL" in August this year, but the fall drink will disappear in weeks. The reason is due to simple economics.
